docs.text: oliver stone's latest feature is the last one standing in the long line of biographies of american presidents .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a three-hour long saga about the life of one of the most hated and misunderstood leaders of the 20th century .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stone doesn't hold back anything as he digs deep inside politics and legal maneuvers of the white house .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the director holds nixon responsible for everything he has done .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at the same time he creates a very human character , a brilliant and tortured man that is caught in the dirty game of politics , which is here pictured as a wild animal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is simply trying to tame it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the occasional switch to the raging sky and the clouds swiftly fleeing over the white house as events run ahead of the president's ability to control them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stone doesn't in any way apologize for nixon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he blames not only nixon's own character flaws but also the imperial presidency itself , the system that , once set in motion , behaves with a mindlessness of its own .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " nixon " is a modern shakespeare story - a saga about a ruler destroyed by his fatal flaws .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's something almost majestic about the process : as nixon goes down in this film , there is no gloating , but a watery sigh , as of a great ship sinking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sir anthony hopkins is staggering and plays nixon with incredible honesty and understanding , creating a very emotional picture of the 37th american president .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joan allen's magnificent and captivating performance is certainly worth an oscar statuette .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is strong and loyal as mrs . nixon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of the cast is equally magnificent , including : james woods , j . t . walsh , paul sorvino , ed harris and bob hoskins .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everyone does a serious and demanding job , no one are disappointing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stone never loses focus and his direction is steddy , honest and determined .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is displaying the historical facts and at the same time concentrating at the human element .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at times he is showing to black and white showing flashbacks from nixon's youth and childhood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the flashy editing by brian berdan and frank corwin , robert richardson's rich cinematography and john williams' musical score create a hectic and bizarre atmosphere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film's only fault is that it's a bit tiering and overloaded with too much political material and legal maneuvers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: still it's an honest and captivating - a solid piece of movie making .
docs.label: positive
